intro: Rhazya orientalis, commonly known as the Arabian coffee plant, is a small evergreen shrub native to the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white to yellowish flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy berries that contain seeds, and it is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Rhazya orientalis is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
